The heavenly light faded away, and Peter felt himself to be in profound darkness; but as his eyes became accustomed 
                                                                           148
to the darkness, it gradually seemed to lessen, and he found himself alone in the silent street, with the cool night air blowing upon his brow. He now realized that he was free, in a familiar part of the city; he recognized the place as one that he had often frequented and had expected to pass on the morrow for the last time.
